intro: Nassauvia sericea, commonly known as silverleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial suitable for arid landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
